verses.t: After{G3326} these things{G5023} Paul{G3588} departed{G5563} from{G1537} Athens{G116}, and came{G2064} to{G1519} Corinth{G2882};

And{G2532} found{G2147} a certain{G5100} Jew{G2453} named{G3686} Aquila{G207}, born{G3588} in Pontus{G4193}, lately{G4373} come{G2064} from{G575} Italy{G3588}, with{G2532} his{G846} wife{G1135} Priscilla{G4252}; (because that{G1223} Claudius{G2804} had commanded{G1299} all{G3956} Jews{G2453} to depart{G5563} from{G1537} Rome{G3588}:) and came{G4334} unto them{G846}.
And{G2532} because{G1511} he was{G2258} of the same craft{G3673}, he abode{G3306} with{G3844} them{G846}, and{G2532} wrought{G2038}: for{G1063} by their occupation{G3588} they were tentmakers{G4635}.
And{G1161} he reasoned{G1256} in{G1722} the synagogue{G3588} every{G3956} sabbath{G4521}, and{G5037} persuaded{G3982} the Jews{G2453} and{G2532} the Greeks{G1672}.

And{G1161} when{G5613} Silas{G4609} and{G2532} Timotheus{G3588} were come{G2718} from{G575} Macedonia{G3588}, Paul{G3588} was pressed{G4912} in the spirit{G3588}, and testified{G1263} to the Jews{G2453} that Jesus{G2424} was Christ{G3588}.

And{G1161} when they opposed{G498} themselves{G846}, and{G2532} blasphemed{G987}, he shook{G1621} his raiment{G3588}, and said{G2036} unto{G4314} them{G846}, Your{G5216} blood{G3588} be upon{G1909} your own{G5216} heads{G3588}; I{G1473} am clean{G2513}: from{G575} henceforth{G3568} I will go{G4198} unto{G1519} the Gentiles{G3588}.

And{G2532} he departed{G3327} thence{G1564}, and entered{G2064} into{G1519} a certain{G5100} man's house{G3614}, named{G3686} Justus{G2459}, one that{G3739} worshipped{G4576} God{G3588}, whose{G3588} house{G3614} joined hard to{G4927} the synagogue{G3588}.

And{G1161} Crispus{G2921}, the chief ruler of the synagogue{G3588}, believed{G4100} on the Lord{G3588} with{G4862} all{G3650} his{G846} house{G3588}; and{G2532} many{G4183} of the Corinthians{G2881} hearing{G191} believed{G4100}, and{G2532} were baptized{G907}.

Then{G1161} spake{G2036} the Lord{G3588} to Paul{G3588} in{G1722} the night{G3571} by{G1223} a vision{G3705}, Be{G5399} not{G3361} afraid{G5399}, but{G235} speak{G2980}, and{G2532} hold{G4623} not{G3361} thy peace{G4623}:

For{G1360} I{G1473} am{G1510} with{G3326} thee{G4675}, and{G2532} no man{G3762} shall set{G2007} on thee{G4671} to hurt{G2559} thee{G4571}: for{G1360} I{G3427} have{G2076} much{G4183} people{G2992} in{G1722} this{G3778} city{G3588}.
And{G5037} he continued{G2523} there a year{G1763} and{G2532} six{G1803} months{G3376}, teaching{G1321} the word{G3588} of God{G3588} among{G1722} them{G846}.

And{G1161} when Gallio{G1058} was the deputy{G445} of Achaia{G3588}, the Jews{G2453} made insurrection{G2721} with one accord{G3661} against Paul{G3588}, and{G2532} brought{G71} him{G846} to{G1909} the judgment seat{G3588},
Saying{G3004}, This{G3778} fellow persuadeth{G374} men{G3588} to worship{G4576} God{G3588} contrary to{G3844} the law{G3588}.

And{G1161} when Paul{G3588} was now about{G3195} to open{G455} his mouth{G3588}, Gallio{G3588} said{G2036} unto{G4314} the Jews{G2453}, If{G1487} it were{G2258} a matter{G5100} of wrong{G92} or{G2228} wicked{G4190} lewdness{G4467}, O{G5599} ye Jews{G2453}, reason{G3056} would that{G2596} I should bear{G430} with you{G5216}:

But{G1161} if{G1487} it be{G2076} a question{G2213} of{G4012} words{G3056} and{G2532} names{G3686}, and{G2532} of your{G5209} law{G3551}, look ye{G3700} to it; for{G1063} I{G1473} will{G1014} be{G1511} no{G3756} judge{G2923} of such{G5130} matters.Actually, the first two tags could be tagged with "kath" & "autoi" respectfully.
And{G2532} he drave{G556} them{G846} from{G575} the judgment seat{G3588}.

Then{G1161} all{G3956} the Greeks{G3588} took{G1949} Sosthenes{G4988}, the chief ruler of the synagogue{G3588}, and beat{G5180} him before{G1715} the judgment seat{G3588}. And{G2532} Gallio{G3588} cared for{G3199} none{G3762} of those things{G5130}.

And{G1161} Paul{G3972} after this tarried{G4357} there yet{G2089} a good{G2425} while{G2250}, and then took his leave{G657} of the brethren{G3588}, and sailed thence{G1602} into{G1519} Syria{G3588}, and{G2532} with{G4862} him{G846} Priscilla{G4252} and{G2532} Aquila{G207}; having shorn{G2751} his head{G3588} in{G1722} Cenchrea{G2747}: for{G1063} he had{G2192} a vow{G2171}.

And{G1161} he came{G2658} to{G1519} Ephesus{G2181}, and{G2548} left them{G2641} there{G847}: but{G1161} he{G1525} himself{G846} entered{G1525} into{G1519} the synagogue{G3588}, and reasoned{G1256} with the Jews{G2453}.
When{G1161} they{G846} desired{G2065} him to{G1909} tarry{G3306} longer{G4119} time{G5550} with{G3844} them{G846}, he consented{G1962} not{G3756};

But{G235} bade{G657} them{G846} farewell{G657}, saying{G2036}, I{G3165} must{G1163} by all means{G3843} keep{G4160} this feast{G3588} that cometh{G2064} in{G1519} Jerusalem{G2414}: but{G1161} I will return{G344} again{G3825} unto{G4314} you{G5209}, if{G2309} God{G3588} will{G2309}. And{G2532} he sailed{G321} from{G575} Ephesus{G3588}.
And{G2532} when he had landed{G2718} at{G1519} CÃ¦sarea{G2542}, and gone up{G305}, and{G2532} saluted{G782} the church{G3588}, he went down{G2597} to{G1519} Antioch{G490}.

And{G2532} after he had spent{G4160} some{G5100} time{G5550} there, he departed{G1831}, and went over{G1330} all the country{G5561} of Galatia{G1054} and{G2532} Phrygia{G5435} in order{G2517}, strengthening{G1991} all{G3956} the disciples{G3588}.

And{G1161} a certain{G5100} Jew{G2453} named{G3686} Apollos{G625}, born{G3588} at Alexandria{G221}, an eloquent{G3052} man{G435}, and mighty{G1415} in{G1722} the scriptures{G3588}, came{G2658} to{G1519} Ephesus{G2181}.

This man{G3778} was{G2258} instructed{G2727} in the way{G3588} of the Lord{G3588}; and{G2532} being fervent{G2204} in the spirit{G3588}, he spake{G2980} and{G2532} taught{G1321} diligently{G199} the things{G3588} of{G4012} the Lord{G3588}, knowing{G1987} only{G3440} the baptism{G3588} of John{G2491}.

And{G5037} he{G3778} began{G756} to speak boldly{G3955} in{G1722} the synagogue{G3588}: whom{G846} when{G191} Aquila{G207} and{G2532} Priscilla{G4252} had heard{G191}, they took{G4355} him{G846} unto{G4355} them, and{G2532} expounded{G1620} unto him{G846} the way{G3598} of God{G3588} more perfectly{G199}.

And{G1161} when he{G846} was disposed{G1014} to pass{G1330} into{G1519} Achaia{G3588}, the brethren{G3588} wrote{G1125}, exhorting{G4389} the disciples{G3588} to receive{G588} him{G846}: who{G3739}, when he was come{G3854}, helped them{G4820} much{G4183} which{G3588} had believed{G4100} through{G1223} grace{G3588}:

For{G1063} he mightily{G2159} convinced{G1246} the Jews{G2453}, and that publickly{G1219}, shewing{G1925} by{G1223} the scriptures{G3588} that{G1925} Jesus{G2424} was{G1511} Christ{G3588}.NOTE! Extra word: "demosios"
